name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1E-N,N'-Bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. The basic unit for comparison can be ethanimidamide, which has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The methylphenyl group (–CH3) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The 4-methylphenyl group (–C(=C)–CH3) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. The amino group (N–C(=N)–) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The methyl group (–CH3) adds approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The presence of two phenyl groups linked in a linear fashion raises the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
